reviews.title: wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reality is they have not kept up with times, choosing to wait for a buyout from a developer, rather than make repairs. Hurricanes have destroyed almost all the docks (they only repaired the charter and boss oyster boat docks), making this unfriendly to transient boaters. Lower level rooms were updated due to flooding. Upper level rooms were not.

reviews.title: Rustic Weekend Getaway
reviews.text: we stayed at the river inn Augusr 12 thru August 14 2005.if your looking for charm not ritz carlton then this is it.the rooms are large for a small hotel and they are well kept.very clean,and the staff is very friendly and helpful.watching the shrimp boats leave and return with their catch was neat for people who are landlubbers like myself.the food of coarse was wonderful and very fresh.there was still some storm damage visible but that did not break the spirit of the people of Appalachicola.they are very friendly and the town is loaded with old world charm.we plan on returning as soon and often as possible.you should look into it yourself you won't be sorry you did.

reviews.title: What a way to relax
reviews.text: Just spent 4 wonderful days in Appalach at the River Inn. Not impressive from the outside, but room was a wonderful surprise. Plenty of room, great view (one of only 2 places to stay with any sort of view at all). Great private balcony out over the Appalachicola River - great for a cigar and some adult beverages of your choice (rooms themselves are nonsmoking). Relaxing just to sit back and watch the birds and river traffic - check out the Osprey nest on top of the river range marker (need field glasses). Rooms were clean, bed very comfortable, and people friendly. Be sure to try Caroline's for breakfast - try the oyster omelet. Our first trip to Appalach, but we will definitely be back and plan to return to River Inn. Appalach is not a place for kids, no rides/slides, beach is about a 1/2 hour drive - try north end of Cape San Blas. Appalach is laid back and unpretensive. Roll up the side walks at sunset. REALLY quiet on Sunday. But if you want a place to kick back and recharge this is IT.

reviews.title: Best view in Apalach
reviews.text: Considering the ambience of the town, we found the Apalachicola River Inn to be delightful. Our room was not the Ritz, but it was clean and spacious, plenty of room for two adults with two 25 pound dogs. Considering the age of the hotel, we felt that they had done a good job keeping the feel of its "working man's town" culture. The balcony, looking directly out over the river, was made for great photos ops and just enjoying the view. The lounge and restaurant were both very good with very friendly wait staff. It was a bit pricey, but it has that great "million dollar view"...... We stayed an extra night!
